result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay L. Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied - summarily

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video from Robert Ellsworth Corr. Inst., in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has filed a motion for sentence adjustment.  Statement by Atty Constable, requesting motion be denied.  Court reviews motion.  Additional argument by State.  Response by Court.  Statement by defendant.  Response by State.  Court ask a question to the State.  State is requesting an adjournment to review matter with probation on new case 15CF136.  Court will adjourn this matter.   Court informs def of the status of motion.

records.descr: Notice to D.A./D.A. response on pet. for sent. adj

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lindsay L. Hodges
Current: 21425 S. Spring St, Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional Center, Union Grove, WI 53182 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2016)
Prior: 537 S. Hudson Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF104  @ 9:58 a.m. Court has reviewed amended revocation summary. Arguments by D.A. Recommends on ct 1 - 3 yrs prison, 1 yr initial, 2 yrs ext supv. conditions as set forth by DOC. On ct 3 -  6 yrs, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv., concurrent to ct 1. Civil judgment for outstanding court obligations and credit for time served - Atty Laufenberg may have total figured. No additions or corrections to packet by either Counsel. Arguments by Atty Laufenberg. Asks Court to follow Dept's recommendation, and 286 days credit. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders on ct 1 -  1 yr initial confinement,  2 yrs ext supv. Convert outstanding court obligations to civil judgment. Conditions as determined by DOC. Ct 3 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial, 2 yrs ext supv. concurrent to ct 1. Convert oustanding court obligations to civil judgment. Credit for 286 days served (both cts). Postconviction rights. Def eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.  15CF136 called @ 10:31 a.m. Same appearances. Status conference set for 4/26/16 @ 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 3:35 pm.  Revocation Summary & Amended summary.  State has reviewed. State explains why amended summary was completed.  Def. got 1st revocation packet.  Atty Laufenberg never got copies of revocation packet.  Court does not think we should continue today. Atty Laufenberg agrees. State is requesting prison.  Court will adjourn so def. can review documents.  Def. request  that  Atty Laufenberg represent def.  Court will allow county appointment handle revocation hearing, so is counsel of record as of today. State will make copies of Amended revocation for all parties, date 12-21-15, Court has received Amended Revocation summary from DA, both parties received copies.  Court will file in record.  COC to talk to JA & agent to see why copy was not given to court of amended.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-16-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls  @  9:41 am.  State explains why calling case, Ct 1 Violation, 4-16-2014 on ct 1, reaffirm plea, Amended Complaint Filed. Date change on Ct's 1 & 2.  Atty Laufenberg agrees to amended & will start jail today @ 6 pm. Def. understand change.  Court explains to def. Violation date was 4-16-2004, & should be 4-16-2014. Def. agrees, Amended Complaint only thing change was violation on Ct's 1 & 2.  Ct 1 will not change plea & with same sentence & jail start today @ 6 pm. Court explains def. rights. Allow amendment & keep plea.  Atty Laufenberg agrees. Amended Information Filed. Court allow filing & corrects date, Court is satisfied plea is valid & reaffirm JOC from last week & jail will start today @ 6 pm. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:37 a.m. Def will plead to cts 1 & 3, remaining cts dismiss and read in, on cts 1 & 3 - withheld sentence, 3 yr probation, state has no objection to early termination if deemed appropriate by agent, 6 months jail, if goes into labor remaining jail will be used by probation for rules violations, report by 6 p.m. on 3/13/15. Court reviews plea quest. and charges. Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Plea to ct 3 - guilty. Court reviews constitutional rights. Finds Def understands, pleas freely made, factual basis and finds guilty of cts 1 & 3, cts 2, 4 & 5 dismissed and read in. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Stipulate 2 weeks credit if revoked. State asks bond applied to court costs, balance be returned to poster. Def has nothing to say.
Court will accept agreement.  On each ct -  Withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, may be discharged early if agent recommends. ct 1 - 6 months jail, huber according to jail rules, court costs, apply bond. Report to jail by 6 p.m. on 3/13/15. If Def goes into labor, may be released from jail and any balance may be used by probation for rules violations. Postconviction rights. DNA sample and surcharge.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:13 a.m. Statements by counsel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls @ 8:54 am.  Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause.  Information Filed. Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve all rights & enters Not Guilty plea on 5 ct's. Court accepts Not Guilty on 5 ct's. Def. will need to keep address current. Bond remains. Atty Laufenberg will get date.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:31 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:58 a.m. Copy received, reading waived. Time limits for prelim waived. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 10:15 am.
